author: Michael Larabel
description: The past few months we have been intrigued by an AMD GFX1250 target added to the LLVM codebase for the AMDGPU shader compiler back-end. GFX12 is RDNA4 and GFX1250 is presumably some "RDNA 4.5" / "RDNA Refresh" part akin to GFX1150 having been for the RDNA 3.5 parts with Strix Halo / Strix Point. The prior LLVM code confirmed GFX1250 is in APU form factor but product details beyond that have been scarce. Today a new AMD GFX1251 target was merged to LLVM...
title: AMD "GFX1251" Target Added To LLVM As Latest RDNA 4.5 APU

author: Michael Larabel
description: Released yesterday was the OpenJDK Java 25 release along with Oracle's GraalVM 25 alternative JVM...
title: OpenJDK 25 & GraalVM 25 Released With 32-bit x86 Support Removed

author: Michael Larabel
description: While down to AMD Austin yesterday for the Instinct MI355X and ROCm 7.0 launch, I had the chance to chat again with Anush Elangovan. As the VP of AI Software at AMD, talking with Anush is always insightful and technical in nature. One of the questions I posed him was around the length of hardware support with ROCm...
title: AMD Hardware Would Ideally Be Supported By ROCm For ~10 Years

author: Michael Larabel
description: GNOME 49.0 is out today as the latest half-year feature release to the GNOME desktop that will go on to power the likes of Fedora Workstation 43 and Ubuntu 25.10...
title: GNOME 49 Officially Released With Wayland Improvements, Showtime As Video Player

author: Michael Larabel
description: When recently carrying out the Windows 11 25H2 vs. Ubuntu Linux benchmarks I also ended up carrying out some Llama.cpp AI benchmarks as the first time exploring the AI inferencing performance between Windows and Linux for both CPU and GPU-accelerated deployments. Here are those results for exploring the Llama.cpp performance between Windows and Linux with different large language models.
title: Latest Open-Source AMD Improvements Allowing For Better Llama.cpp AI Performance Against Windows 11

author: Michael Larabel
description: Yesterday I was invited along with a small group of others to try out the AMD Instinct MI355X accelerator down in Austin, Texas. The AMD Instinct MI355X is fully supported with the newly-released AMD ROCm 7.0...
title: A Quick Look At The AMD Instinct MI355X With ROCm 7.0

author: Michael Larabel
description: Systemd 258 is out today as stable as the latest major feature release to this Linux init system and service manager...
title: systemd 258 Released With systemd-factory-reset & Other New Tools

author: Michael Larabel
description: Microsoft released Azure Linux 3.0.20250910 as the newest version of this in-house Linux distribution used by Azure and other services. Azure Linux 3.0 has long been using the Linux 6.6 LTS kernel while now Linux 6.12 LTS is a new option focused on providing better hardware enablement support...
title: Microsoft Rolls Out A Linux 6.12 LTS Option For Azure Linux

author: Michael Larabel
description: A patch making it to a TIP Git branch this week adds Linux kernel support for detecting the FreeBSD Bhyve hypervisor, which will become important with today's growing server CPU counts...
title: Linux 6.18 To Add Detection For FreeBSD's Bhyve Hypervisor

author: Michael Larabel
description: Intel shipped the Compute Runtime 25.35.35096.9 as their newest monthly feature update to this open-source GPU compute stack for their integrated and discrete graphics wares for providing OpenCL and Level Zero support...
title: Intel Compute Runtime 25.35.35096.9 Ships Newest Features & Optimizations

author: Michael Larabel
description: Mike Blumenkrantz of Valve's Linux graphics team is the one who has been driving the development forward on Mesa's Zink OpenGL-on-Vulkan driver. While traditionally focused on getting OpenGL games running over Zink, recently he has taken to optimizing Zink for workstation graphics...
title: Mesa's Zink Driver Achieves Hits Major Milestone For Workstation Graphics

author: Michael Larabel
description: The BeOS-inspired Haiku open-source operating system project published a new blog post to outline some of their latest development activity. One of the areas they have been focusing on in the performance department has been for addressing much slower git status performance compared to Linux...
title: Haiku OS Addressing Slow "git status" Performance Relative To Linux
